body:
Gender: Female

##EDUCATION
09/2009-06/2013	**East China Normal University (985 Project)**, Shanghai, China

Bachelor of Science in Mathematics and Applied Mathematics

Ranking: **1/214**, Overall GPA: **3.67/4.00**, Major GPA: **3.75/4.00**





- Core Courses: *Mathematical Analysis; Advanced Algebra and Analytical Geometry; Ordinary Differential Equations; Probability and Statistics; Mathematical Modeling; Modern Algebra; Differential Geometry; Real Variable Function; Complex Variable Function*.

Minor: Finance

- Core Courses: *Microeconomics; Economic Statistics; Macroeconomics; Financial Engineering; Monetary economics; International Finance; Accounting*.

09/2013-Present 	**Fudan University**, Shanghai, China

Financial Mathematics and Control Theory, School of Mathematical Sciences

##EXPERIENCE
09/2013-Present **Fudan University**, Shanghai, China

*Researcher, Financial Mathematics Program, School of Mathematical Sciences*

- Conducting a project to validate whether current option price implies future price of its underlying asset.
- Computing the implied volatility from the single-year price data of one option, based on the Black-Scholes Option Pricing Model.
- Analyzing the implied volatility in comparison with the historic volatility.

04/2013-06/2013 **East China Normal University**, Shanghai, China

*Researcher, Department of Mathematics*

- Formulated a density function of urban and rural income distribution respectively based on the maximum entropy distribution and the least square fitting method.
- Estimated the parameters of income distribution using Simulated Annealing Algorithm and Monte Carlo Method.
- Analyzed the figures of income distribution and the tendency of difference between urban and rural area based on Hermite interpolation method.
 
[Summary Link](chenshiyun.us/thesis/index.html)

02/2012 **Meritorious Winner**, *Mathematical Contest In Modeling (MCM)*


- Employed the Multi-Channel Single-Phase queuing theory to model the system of river rafting, minimizing the average contacts with other boats and maximizing the campsite utilization rate under certain restrictions.
- Simulated the stochastic process by taking random variables of different distributions into programming and optimized the schedule of river rafting.

[Paper Link](chenshiyun.us/mcm/index.html)

09/2011 **National Second Prize**, *China Undergraduate Mathematical Contest in Modeling (CUMCM)*


- Employed the Principal Component Analysis to evaluate the interrelationship between different types of metal pollution by SPSS.
- Determined the centroid of metal pollution optimally based on the spatial analysis method.
